{"step_by_step_thinking": "Fluoride is a mineral that's found in many places naturally, including your teeth. It's also added to dental products and some water sources to help strengthen teeth and prevent cavities. Sea fish, tea leaves, human milk, and coconut water all contain fluoride, but the content varies. Sea fish and tea leaves are known to have higher fluoride content due to their environment and absorption properties. However, among these options, tea leaves are known to have the highest fluoride content because they absorb fluoride from the soil and air.", "answer_choice": "B. Tea leaves"}
